instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message:
It's been a while since I worked on this board, but I believe I had occasional backlight with this board previously but the LDVS connector was damaged... I replaced it and I have double, triple checked solder and connector inside but this board acts like it doesn't see the display. I also tried another compatible display with working backlight/image and same.

0V on PPVOUT S0 LCDbklt and over 1V diode red to ground WITH display connected
0V on <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message:
"0V on <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>"
Do you get this voltage at least in the first few seconds (at chime)?
It must appear even if no LCD connected; will go off soon in such case.

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message: Nothing happening at all on <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> before, during, after power-up.

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message:
Did you try without LCD connected?
Be sure no short on any voltage rail of LCD.

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message: Correct. not finding any shorts... Is it probably that issue is with <CHIP>U0500</CHIP> itself?

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> in these first few seconds.
At least one needs to be high, in order to enable <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>.

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message: I get absolutely nothing at either when initializing power to the board

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message: Then should be CPU issue; internal eDP output has been damaged...

threads.title: 3476 external display works, NO image, no backlight
threads.message: Ok. I figured it was a bad outcome. THanks for your help!
